Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ARQuaternionCoordinateId

Enum containing the indices of each coordinate. ARQuaternionCoordinateCount is used to count the total number of coordinates.

Enumerator:
ARQuaternionCoordinateIdW 
ARQuaternionCoordinateIdX 
ARQuaternionCoordinateIdY 
ARQuaternionCoordinateIdZ 
ARQuaternionCoordinateCount

static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionConjugate ( ARQuaternion  q  )  [inline, static]

Get the quaternion's conjugate. For unit quaternions, this is equal to the quaternion inverse.

Parameters:
q the quaternion to compute the conjugate of.
Returns:
the quaternion's conjugate. [w, -x, -y, -z].
static CATransform3D ARQuaternionConvertToMatrix ( ARQuaternion  q  )  [inline, static]

Convert a quaternion to a CATransform3D matrix representation.

Parameters:
q the quaternion.
Returns:
the transformation matrix, with an orientation matching the quaternion's orientation, and with zero translation.

Convert a quaternion to a point, by ignoring its w component.

quaternion the quaternion.
Returns:
the point. [qx, qy, qz].

Get the value of the component with the largest value.

Parameters:
quaternion the quaternion.
Returns:
the value of the largest component. max(|w|, |x|, |y|, |z|).
static BOOL ARQuaternionEquals ( ARQuaternion  a,
ARQuaternion  b 
) [inline, static]

Test whenther two quaternions are exactly equal.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
Returns:
true iff each element of the quaternion is exactly equal. False otherwise.
static BOOL ARQuaternionEqualsWithAccuracy ( ARQuaternion  a,
ARQuaternion  b,
double  accuracy 
) [inline, static]

Test whether two quaternions represent the same rotation or orientation, allowing a small error. This function also returns true if one of the quaternions is negated, since for rotation/orientation quaternions, q represents the same rotation as -q.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
accuracy the maximum allowed error for each coordinate. If one of the coordinates differs more than the accuracy, this function returns false.
Returns:
true iff all elements are equal within the given accuracy, false otherwise. If necessary, one of the quaternions will be negated so that different quaternions representing the same rotation will be detected.
static double ARQuaternionGetCoordinate ( ARQuaternion  quaternion,
ARQuaternionCoordinateId  coordinateId 
) [inline, static]

Return a quaternion's coordinate with the given index.

Parameters:
quaternion the quaternion.
coordinateId the index of the quaternion's coordinate, must be in range [0..4).
Returns:
the requested coordinate.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionMakeWithCoordinates ( double  w,
double  x,
double  y,
double  z 
) [inline, static]

Create a quaternion with the given coordinates.

Parameters:
w The w coordinate.
x The x coordinate.
y The y coordinate.
z The z coordinate.
Returns:
the created quaternion [w, x, y, z].
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionMakeWithPoint ( ARPoint3D  p  )  [inline, static]

Convert a point to a quaternion, setting the w coordinate to zero.

Parameters:
p the input point.
Returns:
the resulting quaternion. [0, x, y, z].
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionMakeWithTransform ( ARTransform3D  transform  )  [inline, static]

Create an orientation quaternion from an transformation matrix. The matrix is assumed to be orthogonal and should not have a scaling applied (ie. the axes must be unit length). The translation component of the matrix is ignored.

Parameters:
transform the input matrix.
Returns:
the resulting orientation quaternion.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionMultiply ( ARQuaternion  a,
ARQuaternion  b 
) [inline, static]

Multiply two quaternions. Note that this is not a element-wise operation.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
Returns:
the resulting quaternion. a*b.

) [inline, static]

Multiply a quaternion by a scalar.

Parameters:
q the quaternion.
s the scalar to multiply by.
Returns:
the resulting quaternion. s*q.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionNegate ( ARQuaternion  q  )  [inline, static]

Negate each element of a quaternion. For rotation quaternions, this results in a quaternion representing the same rotation.

Parameters:
q the quaternion to negate.
Returns:
the negated quaternion. [-w, -x, -y, -z].
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionNLERP ( ARQuaternion  a,
ARQuaternion  b,
double  t 
) [inline, static]

Perform a Normalized Linear intERPolation between two rotation/orientation quaternions, using the shortest great circle distance. The input quaternions should be normalized.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
t the interpolation parameter, a value in range [0..1]. If 0, the result equals a; if 1, the result equals b.
Returns:
A normalized quaternion representing the result of the NLERP operation.
static double ARQuaternionNorm ( ARQuaternion  q  )  [inline, static]

Compute the Euclidean norm ("length") of a quaternion.

Parameters:
q the quaternion.
Returns:
the Euclidean norm of q. sqrt(w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2)
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionNormalize ( ARQuaternion  q  )  [inline, static]

Normalize a quaternion, so that its norm is 1.

Parameters:
q the quaternion.
Returns:
the normalized quaternion, or identity if the quaternion is zero (within a certain acccuracy). This quaternion is quaranteed to be a unit quaternion.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionRotateInDirection ( ARQuaternion  x,
ARQuaternion  dir 
) [inline, static]

Rotate a unit vector in a given direction. The length of dir represents the rotation angle.

Parameters:
x the quaternion, must be a unit quaternion.
dir the direction in which to rotate, must be perpendicular to x. Its length represents the rotation angle.
Returns:
the resulting quaternion, may not be normalized.
static void ARQuaternionSetCoordinate ( ARQuaternion *  quaternion,
ARQuaternionCoordinateId  coordinateId,
double  value 
) [inline, static]

Set a quaternion's coordinate with the given index.

Parameters:
quaternion the quaternion.
coordinateId the index of the quaternion's coordinate, must be in range [0..4).
value the new value of the coordinate.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionSLERP ( ARQuaternion  a,
ARQuaternion  b,
double  t 
) [inline, static]

Perform a Spherical Linear intERPolation between two rotation/orientation quaternions, using the shortest great circle distance. The input quaternions should be normalized.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
t the interpolation parameter, a value in range [0..1]. If 0, the result equals a; if 1, the result equals b.
Returns:
A normalized quaternion representing the result of the SLERP operation.
ARQuaternion ARQuaternionSphericalWeightedAverage ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[],
double  errorTolerance,
int  maxIterationCount 
)

Estimates the spherical weighted average of a set of quaternions. This algorithm may issue unexpected results if the quaternions are not on the same hemisphere.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions
quaternions the quaternions.
weights the weight for each of the quaternions.
errorTolerance the desired accuracy.
maxIterationCount the maximum number of iterations after which the algorithm is cancelled, returning a estimate that is less accurate than the tolerance. Used as a safeguard against (semi) infinite loops.
Returns:
The spherical weighted average.
ARQuaternion ARQuaternionSphericalWeightedAverageInternal ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[],
ARQuaternion  initialEstimate,
double  errorTolerance,
int  maxIterationCount 
)

Estimates the spherical weighted average of a set of quaternions. This algorithm may issue unexpected results if the quaternions are not on the same hemisphere.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions
quaternions the quaternions.
weights the weight for each of the quaternions.
initialEstimate the initial estimate of the result. Must be a unit vector.
errorTolerance the desired accuracy.
maxIterationCount the maximum number of iterations after which the algorithm is cancelled, returning a estimate that is less accurate than the tolerance. Used as a safeguard against (semi) infinite loops.
Returns:
The spherical weighted average.

ARQuaternion  b 
) [inline, static]

Subtract one quaternion from another.

Parameters:
a the first quaternion.
b the second quaternion.
Returns:
the resulting quaternion. a-b.
static ARPoint3D ARQuaternionTransformPoint ( ARQuaternion  q,
ARPoint3D  p 
) [inline, static]

Transform a point by a quaternion.

Parameters:
q the transformation quaternion.
p the point.
Returns:
the transformed point. q' [0, px, py, pz] q.
static ARQuaternion ARQuaternionTransformPointQuaternion ( ARQuaternion  q,
ARQuaternion  p 
) [inline, static]

Transform a quaternion representing a point [0, x, y, z] by another quaternion.

Parameters:
q the transformation quaternion.
p the point quaternion. [0, x, y, z].
Returns:
the transformed point. q' p q.
ARQuaternion ARQuaternionWeightedSum ( int  n,
const ARQuaternion  quaternions[],
const double  weights[] 
)

Compute the weighted sum of a set of quaternions, by computing a weighted sum of all elements individually.

Parameters:
n the number of quaternions.
quaternions the quaternions. Must be of length n.
weights the weights for each of the quaternions. Must be of length n.
Returns:
the resulting sum.

Variable Documentation

const double ARQuaternionEpsilon = 1.e-6 [static]

The epsilon value used by some quaternion functions.

const ARQuaternion ARQuaternionIdentity

Identify quaternion [1, 0, 0, 0]. Note that quaternions have two identity quaternions, since identity represents the same rotation as -identity.

const ARQuaternion ARQuaternionZero

A quaternion with every coordinate set to 0.
